Sentence.sentence: Unfortunately, the current low prices for oil, gas, and coal may provide little incentive for research to find even cheaper substitutes for those fuels.
These likely persistent forces, like the growth of shale ( ' , 页岩) oil, point to a low for long scenario.

The reasoning behind this saying is that low oil prices discourage investment in new production capacity, eventually shifting the oil supply curve backward and bringing prices back up as existing oil fields—which can be tapped at relatively low marginal cost—are depleted.
The dynamic adjustment to low oil prices may, however, be different this time around.
Renewables account for only a small share of global primary energy consumption, which is still dominated by fossil fuels—30% each for coal and oil, 25% for natural gas.
Oil prices have dropped by over 60% since June 2014.
Oil prices are expected to remain lower for longer.
In fact, in line with past experience, capital expenditure in the oil sector has dropped sharply in many producing countries, including the United States.

In addition, other factors are putting downward pressure on oil prices: change in the strategic behavior of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, the projected increase in Iranian exports, the scaling-down of global demand ( ' , especially from emerging markets), the long-term drop in petroleum consumption in the United States, and some displacement of oil by substitutes.
Coal and natural gas are mainly used for electricity generation, whereas oil is used mostly to power transportation, yet the prices of all these energy sources are linked.
A number of factors are driving down the global oil prices not just for now but in the foreseeable future.
A commonly held view in the oil industry is that the best cure for low oil prices is low oil prices.
2 million barrels per day to the crude oil market, contributing to a global over-supply.

And on reflection, this is not surprising; the single word environment has so many dimensions, and there are so many other factors affecting wealth—such as the oil deposits—that teasing out a simple economy-environment relationship would be almost impossible.
Antarctica's mineral, oil and gas wealth are a longer-term prize.
And while assessments vary widely, geologists estimate that Antarctica holds at least 36 billion barrels of oil and natural gas.
According to geologists' estimates, Antarctica has enormous reserves of oil and natural gas.
Whether it is a transition from imported to domestic oil or from coal-powered electricity production to natural-gas power plants, politicians love to talk big.
Every year, people in America use energy equal to over 30million barrels of oil each day.

And on reflection, this is not surprising; the single word" environment" has so many dimensions, and there are so many other factors affecting wealth—such as the oil deposits—that teasing out a simple economy-environment relationship would be almost impos

means: grease ： 通常指经加热变柔软的油脂。
fat ： 多指动物性脂肪，常为固态。
oil ： 泛指植物、动物和矿物性液体油。

word_mean: 油：滑腻易燃的物质，液体，或加热易于液化，可溶于醚，而不溶于水。根据其来源分为动物油，矿物油和植物油
按其遇热后的情况还可分为挥发油和不挥发油
在室温下为液体的脂肪
water separating equipment 由分离器或过滤器或由分离器和过滤器组合的设备，含油污水经其处理后的含油量应不超过万分之一。
包括原油、燃料油、润滑油、油泥、油渣和炼制品在内的任何形式的油。

lj.lj_ly: compliments oil the wheels of life.

phrase.cizu_name: oil (someone's) hand 或 oil (someone's) palm 【非正式用语】

lj.lj_ly: an attorney who tried to oil the judge's hand in order to obtain a directed verdict favorable to his client.
lj.lj_ls: 为使判决导向有利于其委托人的局面而试着向法官行贿的律师

entry.def: Oil is a smooth, thick liquid that is used as a fuel and for making the parts of machines move smoothly. Oil is found underground.

example.ex: The company buys and sells about 600,000 barrels of oil a day.
example.tran: 该公司每天买卖约60万桶石油。

example.ex: ...the rapid rise in prices for oil and petrol.
example.tran: 石油与汽油价格的急剧上涨

entry.def: If you oil something, you put oil onto or into it, for example to make it work smoothly or to protect it.

example.ex: A crew of assistants oiled and adjusted the release mechanism until it worked perfectly...
example.tran: 一班助手给排放装置加润滑油并作调试，直到其达至理想工作状态。

example.ex: The leather may need to be oiled every two to three weeks in order to retain its suppleness.
example.tran: 为了保持皮革的柔韧性，可能两三周就要上一次油。

entry.def: Oil is a smooth, thick liquid made from plants and is often used for cooking.

example.ex: Combine the beans, chopped mint and olive oil in a large bowl...
example.tran: 将菜豆、切碎的薄荷和橄榄油放在大碗里搅拌。

example.ex: Drop the slices into the oil and fry until golden brown.
example.tran: 将切片倒进油里，煎至金棕色。

entry.def: Oil is a smooth, thick liquid, often with a pleasant smell, that you rub into your skin or add to your bath.

example.ex: Try a hot bath with some relaxing bath oil...
example.tran: 用舒缓沐浴油洗个热水澡吧。

example.ex: My sister smeared herself with suntan oil and slept by the swimming pool all day.
example.tran: 我姐姐抹了些防晒油，一整天睡在游泳池边。

example.ex: Her colourful oils and works on paper have a naive, dreamlike quality.
example.tran: 她那些色彩斑斓的油画与纸上作品给人一种天真、梦幻般的感觉。

entry.def: When an artist paints in oils, he or she uses oil paints.

example.ex: When she paints in oils she always uses the same range of colours.
example.tran: 她创作油画时总是使用同一组色彩。

entry.def: If you pour oil on troubled waters, you try to calm down a difficult situation.
If someone or something oils the wheels of a process or system, they help things to run smoothly and successfully.
entry.tran: 使…顺利进行；使…正常运作

example.ex: On all such occasions, the king stands in the wings, oiling the wheels of diplomacy.
example.tran: 在所有这样的场合，国王总是身处幕后确保外交活动的顺利进行。

means.word_mean: 1. a slippery or viscous liquid or liquefiable substance not miscible with water
2. oil paint used by an artist
3. any of a group of liquid edible fats that are obtained from plants
1. cover with oil, as if by rubbing;
2. administer an oil or ointment to ; often in a religious ceremony of blessing

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Northern French olie, Old French oile, from Latin oleum ('olive) oil'; compare with olea 'olive'

sentences.cn: 油价降低的最大受益者是大部分石油需要依靠进口的国家，比如中国、日本和印度。
sentences.en: The biggest gains go to countries that import most of their oil like China, Japan, and India.

sentences.cn: “油价高的时候，许多石油生产国会建立大量的储备资金，所以在油价下跌的时候，他们会利用这些储备金来支持政府开支和补贴消费者。”
sentences.en: “Many oil producers built up huge reserve funds when prices were high, so when prices fall they will draw on their reserves to support government spending and subsidies ( 补贴) for their consumers.”
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 但并非所有的石油生产国都有大量储备。

sentences.cn: 一个原因是，现在有更多国家成为石油生产大国，所以受价格下跌影响的国家占了全球经济更大的比重。
sentences.en: One reason is that more countries are big oil producers now, so the nations suffering from the price drop account for a larger share of the global economy.

Sentence.sentence: They reduce production drastically to boost oil prices.
The reasons behind the plunge of oil prices.
The impact of cheap oil on global economic growth.
The effect of falling oil prices on consumer spending.
The biggest gains go to countries that import most of their oil like China, Japan, and India.
Sara Johnson acknowledges that the global economic benefit from a fall in oil prices today is likely lower than it was in the past.
People the world over are afraid of a further plunge in oil prices.
One reason is that more countries are big oil producers now, so the nations suffering from the price drop account for a larger share of the global economy.
Oil prices may rise or fall but economic laws are not subject to change.
Oil importers account for a larger portion of the global economy.
Many oil producers built up huge reserve funds when prices were high, so when prices fall they will draw on their reserves to support government spending and subsidies ( ' ,  补贴) for their consumers.
Lower oil prices have always given a big boost to the global economy.
In the past, falling oil prices have given a boost to the world economy, but recent forecasts for global growth have been toned down, even as oil prices sink lower and lower.
In Venezuela, collapsing oil prices have sent its economy into free-fall.
Economist Carl Weinberg believes the negative effects of plunging oil prices are overwhelming the positive effects of cheaper oil.
Does that mean the link between lower oil prices and growth has weakened?Some experts say there are still good reasons to believe cheap oil should heat up the world economy.
Consumers will spend their savings from cheap oil on other commodities.
But not all oil producers have big reserves.

But doesn't the extra money in the pockets of those countries' consumers mean an equal loss in oil-producing countries, cancelling out the gains? Not necessarily, says economic researcher Sara Johnson.
And a number of oil-producing countries are trimming their gasoline subsidies and raising taxes, so the net savings for global consumers is not as big as the oil price plunge might suggest.

If you think so, you're not alone, because energy independence has been the dream of American president for decades, and never more so than in the past few years, when the most recent oil price shock has been partly responsible for kicking off the great recession.
Most people would probably say that they want to be independent from imported oil
Second, Americans have basically decided that they don't really want to produce all their own oil.
They value the environmental quality they preserve over their oil imports from abroad
Vast areas of the United States are off-limits to oil exploration and production in the name of environmental protection.
And although you don't read about this much, the United States is also a large exporter of oil products, selling about 2 million barrels of petroleum products per day to about 90 countries
It will bring oil prices down.
Why does America rely heavily on oil imports
It wants to expand its storage of crude oil.
Its own oil reserves are quickly running out
Its own oil production falls short of demand.
What does the author say about oil trade
It saves the cost of oil exploration.
To justify America's dependence on oil imports
To explain the increase of international oil trade.
Some independent thinkers have even produced cars that run on vegetable oil.
In Lagos, foreign oil workers can pay as much as $65,000 per year in rent for a modest apartment in a safe part of town.
